intro: Mastrucium pinnatifidum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mastrucium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, pinnately divided leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
